We get here late afternoon, which gives us enough time to explore this cute town and visit ‘Crazy House’, if you like.

timeline.title: Day 11: Let’s walk down a Waterfall
timeline.description: The next day get ready for the ultimate thrill! We’ll head to the woods, get our gear and start the adventure in the canyon. Hike through lush green rain forest, do some abseiling, walk down a pounding waterfall before we get to the ‘washing machine’. Adrenaline rush guaranteed!

timeline.title: Day 12: Arrive in Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: We leave the mountains and take the bus to our final stop Ho Chi Minh City. This city is buzoldPrice and great to have a good night out.

timeline.title: Day 13: Cu Chi Tunnels & Farewell
timeline.description: Obviously, you can’t visit Vietnam and not learn about the country’s history including the Vietnam War. Our local guide takes us to the Cu Chi Tunnels and gives us a good insight into what happened here.  Later tonight we get ready for the final night and enjoy farewell drinks on one of the rooftop bars. Tonight’s accommodation is still included in your tour.

timeline.title: Day 14: Farewell
timeline.description:
Time to check out (unless you choose to stay a little longer) and make your way to whatever is next on your list. Whether it’s just heading to the airport to catch your flight home or travelling on to more adventures, we will help you with the planning.End point
 New Saigon Hotel, New Saigon Hostel, 270 Bui Vien District 1, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 711200, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrive Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: In and around Ho Chi Minh CityWelcome to Ho Chi Minh city, formerly known as Saigon. This is one of Asia's most exhilarating cities, steeped in grand history and post-Vietnam war memories. This evening you'll meet your travel comrades and explore the Ben Thanh markets, offering the freshest traditional Bánh mì, Pho and Bia hơi. Oh yes, this is the right way to get the Vietnam party started.

timeline.title: Day 2: Ho Chi Minh City to Mekong Delta
timeline.description: It's goodbye busy city and hello river life today as we make for the Mekong Delta for an extra special overnight experience you won't be forgetting fast.Travelling down the river on local sampans, peace and tranquillity will be at an all time high. This afternoon we'll spend our time getting a serious learning fix by visiting a local tea garden and seeing the floating markets, learning about local industries along the river and the way of life here and meet some of the friendliest people on earth. Definitely one to give us all the local feels, topped off with a night at our Mekong Guesthouse.

timeline.title: Day 3: Mekong Delta to Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: After an early breakfast we'll make our way back to Ho Chi Minh, detouring past the staggering 250-kilometres of tunnels that make up the Viet Cong’s Cu Chi.See traps, hidden doors & some of the 250kms of tunnels that Vietnamese resistance fighters dug by hand, and even go down into the skinny tunnels to experience them first hand in this look into Vietnam's staggering past.Back in the addictive mayhem of Vietnam's biggest city you will have free time to carry on your explorations. Continuing to eat your way through Vietnam's culinary highlights would be one wise way to use your time (we think).

timeline.title: Day 4: Ho Chi Minh City to Nha Trang
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangWith some traditional R'n'R on our afternoon agenda, the morning can be used to put on our discovering boots. We'll dabble in history and religion before taking flight to a coastal town overlooking the South China Sea.Golden sand beaches, turquoise oceans, water sports galore - this is Nha Trang. This afternoon why not book in for a mineral mud bath and hot thermal spring experience before heading out to dinner with your crew. Ah, the good life.

timeline.title: Day 5: Nha Trang
timeline.description: Good news - we're kicking it in Nha Trang for another night. Have a massage, sign up for the optional cruise, or just hang on the beach saving your energy for seaside bar fun as the sun sets.

timeline.title: Day 6: Nha Trang to Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnCatch you later Nha Trang and hello Hoi An.Get your bearings with a guided tour through the Old Quarter, and fall deeply in love with this perfect spot. Japanese Bridge, French Colonial vibes and brightly coloured buildings are endlessly charming. You'll be feeling hungry no doubt, so tonight we'll bet we can tempt you with our optional Vietnamese cooking class to get your cooking skills on form and show off to your friends back home. With our expert chef leading the charge, you'll soon be feeling like a bit of an expert. Armed with new skills, ask your Trip Manager about where to head for a night out with the group.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoi An
timeline.description: A short drive from Hoi An are the famous Marble Mountains, a collection of 5 peaks that represent the 5 Elements in Vietnamese folk lore – metal, wood, earth, fire and water. Our local guide would be delighted to take us on a tour through the Thuy Son caves and grottos which are home to some of the most beautiful and intricate stone carvings in the area. The Marble Mountains were also the hiding place of the US Forces during the Vietnam Conflict and even a military hospital! Hear about the history while taking in panoramic views and later, kick back at An Bang Beach before heading back to Hoi An for more Free Time Addons.

timeline.title: Day 8: Hoi An to Hue
timeline.description: In and around HueThough we'll have grown content with Hoi An life, this morning the show must go on. After all, the former imperial town of Hue has invited us over, and we'd be foolish to turn it down.Intricately decorated pavilions, lotus flower ponds, and colourful artworks mark our first sightseeing venture in Hue. Totally in awe of Tu Duc Mausoleum, we move on to the 7-story Thien Mu Pagoda & learn of the horrific history of the Hue Buddhist massacre as well as taking in a cyclo ride to see the city from a whole new angle.

timeline.title: Day 9: Hue to Hanoi
timeline.description: In and around HanoiToday we fly out of Hue in the direction of Vietnam's time capsule capital. A trio of influences and filled with romance, 2-nights here will see us utterly smitten.With an epic fusion of French, Chinese & Vietnamese influence, you'll be nothing short of ecstatic as we check-in to our Hanoi hotel, right in the middle of the bustling Old Quarter. Our time will be spent weaving through a maze of 36 trading streets filled with colourful goods for sale, and unwinding in the walled gardens of the Temple of Literature. Later, we'll roam French-style boulevards and maybe dine on a nom ngo sen lotus-stem salad, dau chien ron fried tofu & a few bia hoi beers.

timeline.title: Day 10: Hanoi to Halong Bay
timeline.description: After a Hanoi history 101 lesson we move on to Halong Bay where a night on a UNESCO World Heritage-listed site awaits.A drive through stunning scenery will evoke plenty of 'oh wow's, but it only gets better as we board our home for the night, a Chinese-style junk boat in Halong Bay. Feel the serenity kicking in immediately as we drift the limestone island seas of the Gulf of Tonkin. We will pass hidden lagoons, thick forests & dreamy grottos, & stop to explore the Sung Sot Caves. A fresh seafood dinner and sunset at our docking spot will polish off a wonderful daypacked with No Regrets moments and simply unforgettable experiences.

timeline.title: Day 11: Halong Bay to Hanoi
timeline.description: Today will be all about the leisurely vibes as we wake up to breakfast and a grotto swim. Make the most of your time on the junk boat & kayak your way around Halong Bay - the views don't get much better than this.After heading back to Hanoi we find ourselves enjoying our final night together on tour. Save the choir of tears for tomorrow - this evening is all about making the most of your free time and staying positive. The quirky world-famous water puppet performance in Red River Delta makes for the perfect send off, should you fancy opting for something a bit different.

timeline.title: Day 12: Depart Hanoi
timeline.description: Enjoy one final breakfast with the squad this morning before the trip wraps up. Hug it out and make plans to reunite sometime soon - Latin America, perhaps?

name: Central Vietnam Culinary Tour
summary: The destination for this tour is Vietnam Centre. The cuisine in central Vietnam is seen by many as the most culturally authentic with the dishes generally well-seasoned and spicy. Plus, the food in this region of the country is heavily influenced by Hue’s culinary traditions and imperial court cuisine. We also have opportunities to discover the 2 heritages site that is Hue citadel and Hoi An ancient town.

timeline.title: Day 1: Hue Arrival
timeline.description: In and around Hue, Da NangMeal: Dinner- Accommodation: Hotel in Hue Arrival at Phu Bai Airport, pick up and drive to Hue, the ancient capital of Vietnam from 1802 to 1945. Afternoon, proceed to Thien Mu, an ancient pagoda and symbol for Hue city. Have a walk around Kim Long Village to visit the original ancient house of the former mandarin, mingle with local people and experience their daily activities in the village.  Have a dinner with Royal meal.

timeline.title: Day 2: Cooking Class – City Tour in Hue
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner- Accommodation: Hotel in Hue We wake up early to discover Dong Ba Market, the biggest wholesale market in Hue for food, vegetable, herb, spices and fruit. Everything is so fresh in the morning and this is best time and best way to have real experiences with the local food and see daily life activities in Hue. After breakfast at the hotel, you will have a chance to enjoy an exciting cyclo trip from the hotel over famous Trang Tien bridge, around the ancient citadel of Hue, getting over the streets, local shops for the overview of daily life and architecture of this famous citadel. The cyclo will take you to  nice restaurant to join in one of the best cooking class in Hue. You will learn how to cook some popular dishes in Hue like Spring roll, Pancake, and Grilled beef, Banana Flower Salad. Then enjoy the food by self-prepared and the restaurant. Afternoon, You will then move on your journey to one of Vietnam’s seven UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Imperial Citadel and the Forbidden City, to find out the hidden charm of this little town. Continue to visit Tu Duc Tomb, one of the most beautiful and picturesque and largest works of architecture of Nguyen Dynasty’s royal palaces and tombs. You will enjoy dinner with typical kind of Hue cake. Overnight in Hue.

timeline.title: Day 3: Hue – Danang – Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnMeal: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner- Accommodation: Hotel in Hoi An Morning departs to Danang through Hai Van Pass. Upon arrival, visit Cham Museum with a great collection of sandstone artifact from 4th to 13th century. Arrive in Hoi An, the little attractive town which was originally one of the major trading centers of Southeast Asia in the 16th century. Lunch at Restaurant. Afternoon, you will stroll on Ancient Hoi An street to discover Hoi An town with Phuc Kien congressional assembly hall, Japanese Cover Bridge and Tan Ky ancient house. In the evening, you will have a chance to try to most famous and popular local food in Hoi An in the restaurant. Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 4: Hoi An Cooking Class
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Hotel in Hoi An Morning you will visit to Tra Que herb village near Hoian. This is a lovely village grow organic herb for supplying to Hoi An people. You will have a chance to interact with the local farmer and learn about many type of herb and the way how they grow them. You then transfer for one of the best cooking class in Hoi An. Starting with learn about Vietnamese ingredients & how to choose fresh foods in the local market.  Next is a short talk on the art of Vietnamese gastronomy, vegetables, herbs & spices & how to prepare & use them. You then back to the class to practice with learning cooking & cutting techniques & how to use a Vietnamese vegetable grater & knife. The menu for this class is:  Fresh Spring Rolls & Shrimp Green Papaya Salad Grilled tuna in banana leave Crispy Pancake Afternoon depart for the cyclo trip to Cam Nam Village, is a nice getaway from the hectic pace of central Old Town. You will have the first stop for the photo opportunity of the activities and scenery on the Thu Bon River. You will cycle along the Thu Bon Riverbank, where you can have a panorama view of Hoi An from another side of the river. Continue riding along the riverside through Cam Nam village to enjoy the peaceful and see the daily life off local people. You can experience the local daily life along river, such as fishing, farming, catching clam…. Come back to Hoi An around sunset time. Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 5: Hoi An – Danang – Departure
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast – Accommodation: N/A You will be free until the convenience time, our car will transfer to the airport for your departure flight.

name: Northern Vietnam Highlight
summary: From Sapa to Halong to Hanoi, Northern Vietnam is hands down the winner when it comes to crowd-pleasing destinations. Start with its capital – Hanoi with its trademark colonial architecture, a labyrinth of tree-lined avenues and narrow alleyways, the ubiquitous presence of street vendors, etc. The very heart and soul of Vietnam possesses a wealth of cultural and historical treasures spanning over a thousand years vividly etched on its every corner and waiting to be uncovered. Take an overnight train and veer off the urban centers to the dreamy, poetic Sapa Town – known for some of the most ravishing terraced landscapes and trekking trails on earth, as well as its hotpot of exotic ethnic minority cultures. Then, proceed from Sapa to Halong – characterized by thousands of limestone outcrops towering over and reflected off its emerald waters, to treat yourself to a perfect mix of indulgence and immersion in one of the New 7 Wonders of Nature.

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi Arrival
timeline.description: In and around HanoiMeals: N/A –  Accommodation: Hotel in Hanoi. Xin Chao! Welcome to Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam. On your arrival, our tour guide will transfer you to your hotel. You are free to relax at the hotel.

timeline.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Overnight on the train. Today you have a full day to explore the capital of Vietnam. You will visit main attraction site in Hanoi like: the Ho Chi Minh Complex (Ho Chi Minh’s Mausoleum, Stilt house, One Pillar Pagoda; the Presidential Palace); the Temple of Literature; the Quan Thanh Temple, Tran Quoc Pagoda & West Lake; and the most attraction museum in Hanoi is the Ethnology Museum or History Museum. Later in the afternoon enjoy a traditional Water Puppet Performance – a unique Vietnamese Art form hailing from Southeast Asia’s wet-rice culture. Transfer to the railway station for night train to Lao Cai.

timeline.title: Day 3: Hanoi – Sapa – Cat Cat Village – Sapa
timeline.description: Day 3 Sapa- Ta Van- Giang Ta Chai- Sapa Meal: Breakfast- Accommodation: Hotel in Sapa Upon arriving at the Lao Cai Railway Station, you will be picked up and transferred to the hotel for check-in (If room available). After breakfast, you will start a lovely trekking in the spectacular landscape of Lao Chai Village, home of the Black H’mong, to have a glimpse of tribal life on the mountain. Enjoy a pleasant picnic lunch and continue your highland adventure to visit the Dzay people in Ta Van village, whose houses nestled in a beautiful valley that provides the best view of intoxicating rice terraces in Vietnam. Keep trekking through a bamboo forest; you will finally reach Giang Ta Chai village of Red Dzao tribe for a tour. Later in the day, you will head back to the Sapa Town and enjoy some free time in the Sapa Market.

timeline.title: Day 4: Sapa – Lao Chai Village – Ta Van Village – bus to Hanoi
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast - Accommodation: Hotel in Hanoi After breakfast in Sapa, meet up our guide and driver at your hotel and transfer to Fansipan Cable Car station to begin the journey conquering Fansipan by modern cable car system. The cable car system in Sapa is the world’s longest and highest cable car, running up from sleepy Sapa Town in Lao Cai Province to the peak of 3,143-meter. Fansipan Mountain, known as Indochina’s rooftop. Reaching Mount Fansipan used to mean a full-day hike at least. But from Feb 2016 the trek up will be reduced to a 25-minute flight by cable car. The 6.5km long cable car can carry a maximum of 2,000 passengers an hour, with each cabin accommodating 35 passengers. While traveling by cable car, you can enjoy the scenery and magnificent views to Sapa and swallow views of Muong Hoa valley, Hoang Lien National Forest as well as beautiful landscapes of Lai Chau province. After conquering the Fanipan Peak, you will also take able car to get back the foot of mountain. Then you will be transferred back to Sapa, take the shuttle bus to Hanoi. You arrive at the hotel at 10 PM. Overnight in hotel.

timeline.title: Day 5: Hanoi – Halong Bay – Overnight on cruise.
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner – Accommodation: on cruise After breakfast, about 8:00 am we will pick you up at your hotel, it takes you about 4 hours to the UNESCO World Heritage Site – Halong Bay. Embark on the cruise by transfer tender boat. Listen to cruise briefing and receive the room key. Savor a delectable lunch when the boat cruises further along the limestone islands of Ha Long Bay, heading to Centre of the World Heritage  – on the way, you will have a chance to take the most beautiful pictures and enjoy the best sightseeing from your private room or sundeck. You will pass through the magical bay, where thousands of sculpted limestone islands rise from the waves like dragons’ teeth. After lunch, you will take a short trek to a nearby summit for a panoramic view of the bay, swimming on a quiet beach or sunbathing on the sundeck. You will stay overnight onboard.

timeline.title: Day 6: Halong Bay – Hanoi
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast, Brunch – Accommodation: hotel in Hanoi Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, you will have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay. After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave (8 a.m. to 9 a.m.), swim and relax at Soi Sim beach. At 9:30 a.m., your boat cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served from 10:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. You will continue cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cabin check-out is at 11:45 am. The boat arrives at the harbor around noon and you will drive back to Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi Departure
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast, Brunch – Accommodation: n/a After breakfast at the hotel, the guide will accompany you to the airport to catch your scheduled flight.

name: A Journey Through Vietnam (Overnight on board in Halong Bay)
summary: Discover the 8 days A Journey Through Vietnam Overnight on board includes a night aboard a traditional sailing vessel in one of the most beautiful spots on Earth: Ha Long Bay, a UNESCO World Heritage Natural Site of outstanding natural beauty, known in Vietnamese as Dragon descending to the sea. Start your trip from Hanoi and ending at Saigon, the largest city in Vietnam. You have got a chance to experience the cultural treasures and stunning lakes, mountains and powdery beaches of this mesmerioldPrice country, The rural life of villagers among the paddy fields and relax on a boat trip in spectacular Halong Bay. It is home to an interesting diversity of religions, cuisines and natural landscapes. This is a journey of a lifetime memory.

timeline.title: Day 1
timeline.description: In and around Da NangAlthough it is the modern-day capital of Vietnam, Hanoi still retains the mystery and charm of past centuries. Narrow lanes and traditional shop houses invite an exciting exploration by walking, while it's many beautiful public spaces; lakes, parks, tree-lined boulevards and monuments; give the city an air of elegance and harmony with nature unique among Asian capitals. Visit the Temple of Literature The Temple of Literature has a peaceful series of walled courtyards and graceful gateways, and this monument is one of the best-preserved examples of traditional Vietnamese architecture. Founded in 1070 and dedicated to Confucius, this was also the site of Vietnam's first university. In one courtyard, giant stone tortoises bear stele on their backs, listing the accomplishments of graduating scholars. Walk the Rail Tracks of Hanoi Start the tour on the rails a few meters north Hanoi's main train station. Walk along the very narrow streets hosting the rails sometime not even a metre far from the entrance door of houses. Enjoy this original and photogenic scene walking along the street until 153 Phung Hung where you go back down to the road and follow the street's sidewalk. Walk past a funeral home where you will see a group of people mourning and wearing the traditional white fabric around the forehead, which is the local equivalent to the western tradition of wearing black clothes. Continue walking toward Long Bien train station. From Long Bien train station start to cross the bridge and stop half way to go down the stairs onto the urban island. Have a rest and visit the orchards. Continue crossing the bridge and meet with the car which will transfer you to Gia Lam train station. Take your train ticket and jump in to cross the bridge on the other way, riding with the locals in the hard seater wagon. On week days you will stop at Long Bien, and on Saturday and Sunday you will stop at Hanoi Station. Meet your driver after disembarking and transfer back to your hotel. - Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 2
timeline.description: By vehicle from Hanoi (city) to Halong Bay Stop en-route for stretch your legs and use the restroom at one of the souvenir shop for charity. Aboard the traditional cruise through Halong Bay, Day 1 of 2 * No local guide * Depart from Hanoi to Halong Bay; en route take a short stop for a break. Transfer with a tender to the comfortable cruise and enjoy a welcome drink aboard. Begin the cruise through majestic Halong Bay while lunch is served. Enjoy the magical bay where thousands of sculpted limestone islands rise from the waves like dragon's teeth. The cruise continues cruising through a fishing village on the bay and passes the spectacular limestone caves dotted around the bay. Soak up the sun on the top deck with optional on-board activities: sunbathing, and photo opportunities. In the evening the chef will prepare a splendid meal comprised of fresh seafood dishes and other traditional dishes. Overnight on-board - Overnight in cabin / onboard (Vietnam)

timeline.title: Day 3
timeline.description: Aboard the traditional cruise through Halong Bay, Day 2 of 2 * No local guide * Greet the day with a morning Tai Chi exercise that offer a perfect opportunity to view the sunrise over the bay. After breakfast, visit a beautiful limestone grotto then back to the boat for a final glimpse of the Halong Bay while cruising back to the dock. Check out luggage and bid tidings to beautiful Halong Bay. By vehicle from Halong to Hanoi (Noi Bai Airport) Flight from Hanoi to Hue Transfer - Overnight in Hue

timeline.title: Day 4
timeline.description: Thuy Bieu village with Cooking Class Pick you up at Toa Kham Wharf, then visit Thien Mu pagoda a historic temple, the symbol of Hue city. Back to the boat for a scenic cruise to Thuy Bieu Eco-village for cooking class. Go to Thuy Bieu local market (located near Thuy Bieu village), take time to stroll around and buy necessary foods for cooking class with chef. Prepare lunch (or dinner) by yourself under the instruction of our chief. After your practical class, it's time to taste the Hue traditional dishes that you have prepared and our chef will be able to give his feedback on your own chef skills. Then, spend 2 hours to stroll or bike around peaceful village. Relax by steeping your foot in medicinal herb water a traditional therapeutic practice and enjoy therapeutic massage by the blind people. Sightseeing in the Imperial Citadel Located in the heart of Hue is the Imperial Citadel, a vast complex built in the early 19th century and modelled after the Forbidden City of Peking. The original walls stretched for 10 km and were surrounded by a wide moat. Today, most of the buildings have been destroyed due to bombing during the Vietnam-American War, but the monuments that remain provide a fascinating glimpse into the court life of the Nguyen Dynasty. Approach the city past the striking Flag Tower, where a giant Vietnamese flag waves proudly overhead, to the imposing Ngo Mon Gate, the main entrance to the Imperial Enclosure. Enter into an area of spacious courtyards and serene lotus ponds, and stroll around the Dien Tho Residence (Dien Tho Palace) where the Queen mother lived. Visit the Thai Hoa Palace, the magnificently decorated reception hall, the Halls of the Mandarins, and the original Nine Dynastic Urns, among other sites - Overnight in Hue

timeline.title: Day 5
timeline.description: Sightseeing in Hue Hue served as the capital of Vietnam for more than 140 years. It houses ancient temples, imperial buildings and French-style edifices. It was established in the 17th century. Visit the Imperial Tombs of Tu Duc and Khai Dinh Venture into the countryside around Hue to the Imperial Tomb of Tu Duc. Tu Duc, the longest reigning Vietnamese emperor, designed and built this elegant tomb during his lifetime, using it as a retreat for meditation, reading and theatre performances. Take some time to soak in the tranquil atmosphere, wandering among the gracefully proportioned pavilions, courtyards and lotus ponds. Afterwards visit the Imperial Tomb of Khai Dinh, dramatically located on a hillside. The last of the monumental tombs of the Nguyen dynasty, completed in 1931, this tomb incorporates distinct European elements into traditional Vietnamese architecture. By vehicle from Hue to Hoi An with sightseeing in Danang Drive south from Hue along scenic mountain roads with spectacular views over the coastline. Highlights along the way include the dramatic Hai Van Pass, the high dividing line between the climate zones of North and South Vietnam; Lang Co, a lovely stretch of beach curving outwards between a clear blue lagoon and the East Vietnam Sea; and the large coastal city of Danang. After arriving in Danang, visit the Cham Museum, an elegant colonial building which houses the finest collection of Cham sculpture in the world; and pass by Non Nuoc Beach, a famous spot for American soldiers during the Vietnam-American War. Continue south to Hoi An, stopping enroute to visit the Marble Mountains, five stone hillocks, once islands, that rise sharply from the surrounding rice fields. Riddled with caves and shrines, they are said to each represent one of the five elements of the universe - Overnight in Hoi An

timeline.title: Day 6
timeline.description: Sightseeing in Hoi An with a boat trip on the Thu Bon River The exquisitely preserved merchant town of Hoi An was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1999. Its colourful shop houses and temples reflect a diverse heritage, dating back to the 16th and 17th century, when it was a major port for Western, Chinese and Japanese traders. Today it is a thriving centre of traditional crafts and a shopper's paradise, best explored on foot. Wander through the cobbled streets, past low tile-roofed buildings, the bustling central market and the small harbour where colourfully painted boats are moored. The walking tour will include visits to a private house, where members of the same family have lived continuously for centuries in a traditional setting; to one of the family chapels built by prominent merchants and official families as centres for ancestor worship; and to a typical Chinese-style Pagoda or assembly hall. Continue to Sa Huynh MUSEUM, located near the Japanese Covered Bridge, it contains exhibitions from the earliest period of Hoi An's history. Visit a handicraft workshop in Hoi An where local products are being made by the industry itself. Finally, continue to the famous Japanese Covered Bridge, first constructed in 1593 by the Japanese community of Hoi An to link the town with the Chinese quarters across the stream.  In the afternoon, board a local boat and cruise down the Thu Bon River, enjoying the unspoiled countryside and stopping to visit a pottery village and a woodcarving village before returning to Hoi An harbour - Overnight in Hoi An

timeline.title: Day 7
timeline.description: Transfer to Danang airport  Flight from Danang to Saigon Transfer  Sightseeing in Saigon A vibrant metropolis, Saigon teems with energy, activity and motion. Everywhere you look, you see the convergence of traditional and modern life. Begin the trip into modern history with a tour of the Reunification Palace. Formerly the Independence Palace of the South Vietnamese president, this 60s style building was famously stormed by tanks on April 30, 1975 signifying the fall of South Vietnam. It has been preserved in its original state, and the original tanks remain on display near the entrance gates.  Afterwards, drive to the historic centre to visit the Emperor of Jade Pagoda, one of Saigon's most interesting pagodas. Proceed to pay a quick visit to the neo-Romanesque Notre Dame Cathedral and the Central Post Office. Pass by the classic European-style landmarks such as the ornate City Hall (Hotel De Ville), the old Opera House (both may only be viewed from the outside). Finally, end up at the central Ben Thanh Market, where vendors display a vast array of goods and handicrafts, appealing to every taste - Overnight in Saigon

timeline.title: Day 8
timeline.description: Transfer from Hotel to Airport for your Departure Flight.

name: Vietnam North
highlights: Explore Hanoi by bike and gliding on a bamboo boat
Head to Hue in open-top jeeps along the Hai Van Pass
Go on explorations in caves at Phong Nha National Park
Learn the art of how to cook classic Vietnamese cuisine
Cruise the aquamarine waters of stunning Ha Long Bay

timeline.title: Day 1 - Airport Pick Up
timeline.description: In and around Da NangToday is arrival day; feel free to arrive any time. You will be picked up from Da Nang airport by one of our drivers, who will be waiting for you. Then head to the hotel where your group leader will be waiting for you. Get excited to meet your new travels buddies for dinner and drinks in the evening.

timeline.title: DAY 2 - Basket boat trip
timeline.description: Start the day with a bike tour around Hoi An old town and lunch at the locals family home. Then spend the afternoon crab fishing with the locals as we explore the 7 hectare water coconut woods in traditional bamboo basket boats. The late afternoon is free to chill or explore the lantern filled streets.

timeline.title: Day 3 - HAI VAN PASS
timeline.description: An adventure filled day as we leave Hoi An in open-top Jeeps & hit the Hai Van Pass, featured as the ‘Top Gear Experience’ it’s the perfect way to travel to Hue. Stop for a spot of lunch (included) and enjoy a nice swim in the sea before heading off again. On arrival to Hue we check into our new hotel & head into town for dinner and a few drinks in the evening.

timeline.title: Day 4 - COOKING CLASS & imperial city
timeline.description: Today it’s time to explore the historic imperial city of Hue. We head off to the Royal Palace where we take in the history of the nation`s former capital city before joining a local cooking school to learn how to make some traditional Vietnamese dishes. After we’re full of delicious food, we then head over via bus to the small town of Phong Nha, where we arrive early evening & just in time to enjoy a few drinks in one of the local bars.

timeline.title: day 5 - Phong Nha National Park
timeline.description: Paradise Cave is a UNESCO World Heritage site, & is famous for being one of the longest cave systems in the world at 31 km. We spend the day exploring the caves and doing a little ziplining, both of which are situated inside Phong Nha National Park. In the evening we jump on an overnight bus to Hanoi.

timeline.title: DAY 6 - HANOI
timeline.description: In and around HanoiWe arrive early morning into Hanoi & head straight to our hotel to check in. As the rooms are still being prepared, we check out a local cafe and experience how to make traditional egg coffee which is a famous dessert in Hanoi. In the early afternoon, we’ll visit the famous Hanoi train street and then have the rest of the afternoon free for you to chill or explore the city on your own.

timeline.title: day 7 - Ha long Bay
timeline.description: We leave early by bus & boat to head to the famous Castaway Island in Ha Long Bay. Once checked into our beachside accommodation, we enjoy lunch with the most amaoldPrice view before an afternoon of watersports & an evening of beach partying.

timeline.title: day 8 - Ha long Bay Boat trip
timeline.description: We spend our full day aboard a traditional junk boat cruising through Ha Long Bay. During the trip we stop off to kayak through ancient caves & a network of lagoons whilst looking out for monkeys, before relaxing on the boat during the afternoon with plenty of swim stops.

timeline.title: day 9 - Travel to hanoi
timeline.description: After a few big nights on our private island, we enjoy another lay in before enjoying our last beachfront lunch, before making the journey back to Hanoi where we check in to our accommodation for our final night together as a group.

timeline.title: day 10 - chilled check out
timeline.description: It's time to say goodbye to one another as everyone heads off on their separate ways. Whether you’re continuing around Southeast Asia, or heading to the airport to go home, your Group Leader will help you to get you where you’re going.

name: South & North Vietnam - 6 Days
summary: The best quality and unbeaten price for 06 Days Trip100% Guaranteed DepartureNO hidden Cost, NO OptionalStart in Ho Chi Minh City and finish in HanoiChillout and shopping in Ho Chi Minh City - the biggest City in VietnamCruise on Mekong River and visit Floating MarketsVisit Hanoi, stay in Boutique hotel inside the Old QuarterStay overnight on Boat in Halong Bay - World Heritage SiteTaste wonderful Vietnamese local cuisines along the tripAnd more...
highlights: Step back to times of war as you crawl through the Cu Chi Tunnels
Be entertained by the amaoldPrice Water Puppet Show in Hanoi
Discover enchanting caves on an overnight cruise of Halong Bay

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrival Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityToday you’ll land in Ho Chi Minh City (Tan Son Nhat International Airport). Warmly welcome by Tour Guide & Car Driver at airport then transfer to hotel for check in. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similarStart point
 Airport pick up, Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Quận Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 736400, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 2: Mekong Delta - Cai Be floating market full day (B/L)
timeline.description: In and around Cai BeHaving breakfast at hotel until 7:30 am. Depart for Cai Be, stopping to take photos in Tan An town overlooking the picturesque flat rice fields. On arrival in Cai Be, take a motor boat to visit the Cai Be floating market and watch the locals trading fruit and many other commodities on board their vessels. Then wander into the small villages to visit the orchard and fruit plantation. Keep cruising to Vinh Long through a series of small canals to experience the charms of the Upper Mekong Delta. Visit a small family business to see how coconut candy and crispy rice popcorn are made. Arrive in Binh Hoa Phuoc village, the green pearl of Vinh Long town, where you can immerse yourself in nature. Enjoy a lunch of fresh river food served in the heart of the garden accompanied by traditional southern Vietnamese folk music. Take a delightful walk through the bonsai garden. Meet the driver again in Vinh Long. Return to Ho Chi Minh City. Check in hotel & overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similar

timeline.title: Day 3: Ho Chi Minh City Tour - Cu Chi Tunnels - fly to Hanoi (B/L)
timeline.description: In and around Hanoi, Cu Chi TunnelsToday you will visit the largest Vietnamese city. There are street markets, sidewalk cafes and sleek new bars. This teeming metropolis offers 300 years of timeless traditions and the beauty of an ancient culture. To the west of the city is the huge Chinese neighborhood called Cho lon, which means "Big Market." Notre Dame Cathedral, in the heart of Saigon's government quarter, is of neo- Romanesque architecture with two high square tower and iron spires. The Central Post Office is French-style and City Hall, known as "Hotel de Ville," is typical of the French architecture that would be seen in any village in France. Visit the War Remnants Museum, featuring collections of weapons and photographs from the two Indochina wars. Leave Saigon for Cu Chi Tunnels to learn about Vietnam history & Vietnam War. After Cu Chi Tunnels you will take flight to Hanoi by Vietnam Airlines. Arrive Hanoi in the evening. Transfer to hotel for check in. Stay overnight in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi or similar

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi - Halong Bay Cruise stay overnight on Board (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Early this morning, we’ll drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. We’ll spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since we’re overnight on the water, we’ll be able to explore Ha Long Bay’s most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Boat. Garden Bay Cruises or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Halong Bay Cruise – Hanoi. (B/L)
timeline.description: Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, we have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay. After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave, swim and relax. Cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served while you are cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cruise check-out. Rejoin car drive back to Hanoi for overnight. Arrive Hanoi at 3:00pm. Check in hotel & free time to go sightseeing in the Old Quarter. Take part in Water Puppet Show an hour. Overnight in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi or similar

timeline.title: Day 6: Hanoi Conclude/ Departure. (B)
timeline.description:
You have the morning free to relax before your return flight home. Finish your unforgettable trip arranged by Legend Travel Group. Good bye & see you again!End point
 Airport transfer, Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam

name: Quick Look Vietnam from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi - 7 Days
summary: Ho Chi Minh City: City tour including entry to the War Remnants Museum & Cu Chi Tunnels.Mekong Delta: Take an excursion to Mekong Delta, with a boat trip on the Mekong River to visit Floating markets.Hanoi: Sightseeing activities: Water Puppets performance; visit Ho Chi Minh’s mausoleum, One Pillar Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Museum, Presidential Palace, and Temple of Literature; take a “cyclo” ride through the Old Quarter. (optional, discover by yourself)Halong Bay: Overnight cruise in a traditional Junk boat, discover caves & fishing villages, explore the lagoon.Mai Chau Valley: Escape from City to Bakhan Village Resort - the best brand new Mountain resort in the Northwest of Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 1: Ho Chi Minh City Arrival
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityToday you’ll land in Ho Chi Minh City. Warmly welcome by Car Driver at airport then transfer to Saigon Downtown. Check in hotel. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City Airport Pick up is Optional service. You`ll pay extra 15 US$/ Per Person (pay in location) if you need picking up at airport upon arrival or you can arrange your own transfer from airport to hotel. In case of arriving before departure date of the trip, you will check in the hotel by your own following the address below: Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon Address: 265 Phạm Ngũ Lão, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam Phone: +84 28 3836 4556Start point
 Pick up at Airport upon arrival (Optional), Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Quận Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 736900, Vietnam

Arrive hotel around 5:00pm. Check in hotel and stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similar

timeline.title: Day 3: Full day to Mekong Delta/River Boat Trip - Fly to Hanoi (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiToday takes you to My Tho, the capital of Tien Giang Province. Situated on the Mekong River, 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, the city is surrounded by orchards and rice fields, which produce grain for the entire country. Visit one or two of the islands that produce traditional handcrafts, coconut candy and bee farms. Visit the Vinh Trang Pagoda, the oldest one in the delta on your boat trip on the Mekong River. Return to Ho Chi Minh City around 3:00pm - 4:00pm. Pack your luggage the transfer to Airport for flight to Hanoi (1,5 hours). Pick up upon arrival Hanoi Airport by Driver. Transfer to hotel in Hanoi for check in. Stay overnight in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi or similar

timeline.title: Day 4: Excursion to Halong Bay and Stay overnight on Board. (B, L, D)
timeline.description: Early this morning, we’ll drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see.
