name: Discover Vietnam
summary: Vietnam effortlessly blends a modern bustling Asia with the exotic vibe of the old and traditional. Embrace the enchanting Vietnamese culture through adventure, exploration and volunteering whilst having a damn good time on this two week experience!Starting in Hanoi, Vietnam's bustling capital, you'll cruise the waves amongst the awe-inspiring limestone cliffs of Ha Long Bay before continuing onto one of South East Asia's most majestic and impressive natural landscapes: Ninh Binh. You will then volunteer with the local community in the imperial city of Hue, drift along the scenic coast of the Hai Van Pass, before finishing the experience of a lifetime roaming through the picturesque streets of Hoi An.

timeline.title: DAY 1 (FRI) WELCOME
timeline.description: This is it then, the starting point! We know that you'll be excited, nervous, apprehensive or all three, so to help ease you into life here in Vietnam, our team will collect you from the airport and transfer you to our first base and set you up ready to begin this epic adventure. As we'll have traveller's arriving throughout the day you can choose to either rest up or explore locally as we collect all the new arrivals and have a huge group hug! In the evening, for those who are lucky enough to have already arrived, there'll be an informal get-together, a great way to get to know your fellow give-back-packers!

timeline.title: DAY 2 (SAT) LET'S EXPLORE
timeline.description: We’ll kick today off with breakfast and an informative orientation so you can get your bearings and find out about all the activities, rules of the road and what we have planned for you during your trip. Once you’ve got your head around the info, we'll head into town for a walking tour and visit the scenic Hoan Kiem Lake, the Temple of Literature, and the old French quarter. In the evening you’ll have the opportunity to watch a traditional water puppet show before enjoying a delicious meal in the city’s old quarter. If you’re still thirsty for more, it’s off to Beer Street for a few drinks! Meals Included: Breakfast & Dinner

timeline.title: DAY 3 (SUN) HA LONG BAY
timeline.description: Hopefully, you’re not feeling too fragile this morning as it’s an early start. We will be making our way to Vietnam’s extraordinary Ha Long Bay. The journey takes around 3-4 hours, so there’s plenty of time to catch up on your beauty sleep. Once we’re at the dock, we’ll set off on a cruise through the iconic emerald waters dotted with thousands of imposing limestone cliffs. You’ll even get the chance to kayak if you don’t mind getting wet! Lunch will be provided to keep you going through the day, and in the evening we’ll sit down for a group meal while watching the sunset - how nice does that sound?! Expect the drinks to be flowing in the evening along with a few questionable song choices (and that’s just from your guides!) Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner

timeline.title: DAY 4 (MON) NINH BINH
timeline.description: You’ll have a final opportunity to kayak and swim in the beautiful bay after breakfast and before we head back to the mainland. In the afternoon we’ll be making our way to Ninh Binh to check into our accommodation and explore the town's surroundings. Later on that evening we’ll meet up with the gang and see what everyone wants to do. Meals Included: Breakfast

timeline.title: DAY 5 (TUE) NINH BINH
timeline.description: You’ll be able to get out and really explore Ninh Binh today. Did you know that in 2016 the Hollywood blockbuster King Kong was filmed here? Well, you do now! So let’s grab the opportunity and hop on a bike for a closer look at the town and the surrounding countryside. We will also make time for a cruise along the Tam Coc River which is, without a doubt, one of the most picturesque places in northern Vietnam. In the evening we’ll board the night bus and move to our next location, Hue. Meals Included: Breakfast

timeline.title: DAY 6 (WED) HEY HUE
timeline.description: In and around Hue Arriving in Hue this morning, we'll get you checked in, give you a chance freshen up and have some breakfast. After lunch we'll walk down to the Perfume River through the park and board our private boat for a relaxing ride down stream. Kick back and relax before we arrive at Thien Mu Pagoda, Vietnam's tallest religious building at seven tiers high. In the evening, you will receive a pre volunteering orientation, so you're ready for some hard work for next three days! Meals Included: Breakfast

timeline.title: DAY 7-9 (THUR-SAT) VOLUNTEERING
timeline.description: It’s that time, so let's give something back because that’s what we do best! Working alongside one of the top NGOs in Vietnam, your three days on the project will have you rolling up your sleeves and getting your hands dirty. Community development is something Bamboo loves to support and such projects include: building toilets for families, building sustainable chicken farms and pens and educating the community on how to provide food and a steady income for the future. Projects can change depending on a number of factors and we work on whatever is most needed at the time. Whichever project you’re involved in, rest assured your hard work will make a difference to the people who really need it. That’s just how we roll. On your last evening, and after you’ve had a massive pat on the back, let the games begin as we spend the night enjoying Hue’s vibrant nightlife one last time. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch.

timeline.title: DAY 10 (SUN) HOI AN
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An Making our way to the historic town of Hoi An today, we’ll travel down the famous Hai Van Pass – a scenic, winding road with panoramic views. If the weather’s kind to us, we’ll stop at a secluded waterfall known as the Elephant Springs, or we will stop along the road at Da Nang and walk amongst the Marble Mountains - the perfect photo op. Meals Included: Breakfast

timeline.title: DAY 11 (MON) BICYCLE CLUB
timeline.description: Today we’ll head out on an epic bicycle ride through the beautiful streets of Hoi An. We will venture out into the countryside, riding through the stunning rice paddocks and run into a buffalo or two. The bike tour ends at the water's edge where your basket boat awaits. This is a unique experience that not many visitors know about, and we’re sure you’ll love it! After lunch by the river you'll be treated to a round of traditional Vietnamese games (prizes are involved!) before heading back into town for a night out. Meals Included: Breakfast

timeline.title: DAY 12 (TUE) FREE TIME
timeline.description: Time for some relaxation, so make the most of being in a great location to explore! The Old Quarter is packed full of pretty yellow buildings, boutiques, tailor shops, and quaint coffee shops. Book yourself into a cooking class at the famous Green Mango Restaurant with a world-famous chef; or if the sun’s out, take a trip down to An Bang Beach for ultimate relaxation on the sand. This evening we can all get together for a final group meal - no need to worry, this one’s on us. Meals Included: Breakfast, Dinner

timeline.title: DAY 13 (WED) GOODBYE'S
timeline.description: That’s it! It’s time to say bye-bye. Our team will be there to help you to arrange any transport you might need, be it back to the airport or wherever you're heading. One final group photo? Oh, go on then! Meals Included: Breakfast

name: Vietnam Historic & Phu Quoc Island
summary: Vietnam is a treasure trove waiting to be discovered, so scratch your travel itch with our the best Vietnam holiday destinations in 14 days, allowing you to not only see but ‘live’ the place! Start the country’s very heart and soul – Hanoi – formerly known as Thang Long or Ascending Dragon, with imprints of the bygone eras vividly etched on its every corner. Embrace the revitalioldPrice display of natural beauty and cruise the signature emerald waters of Ha Long Bay – or the Bay of Descending Dragons, peppered with bizarre rock formations!Travel southwards to the former entrepot of Hoi An to savor its beguiling manifestation of cultures and architectural styles, as a result of being one of the busiest trading ports in Southeast Asia. Three hours away from Hoi An is Hue – Vietnam’s imperial capital in the early 19th to mid-20th centuries, where you get to trace the country’s centuries-old history through the architectural legacy of the Ancient Citadel, Forbidden City, and royal tombs.Further south is the cosmopolitan Ho Chi Minh City, a perfect place to get the pulse of modern Vietnam. Pay a visit to the historic tunnels of Cu Chi before drifting down the mighty Mekong River and lose yourself in the labyrinth of water arteries and sprawling velvety rice paddies. Last but not least, treat yourself to a purely hedonistic pursuit while reuniting with nature in its truest form at the same time in Phu Quoc, one of the best island paradises in Vietnam.

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrive in Hanoi
timeline.description: In and around Hanoi, Da NangMeal: NA – Accommodation: Hotel in Hanoi. Your guide will greet you at the airport beside the baggage-claim area and then take you to the pre-booked hotel. The rest of the day is left for your own arrangement.

timeline.title: Day 2: Hanoi
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Hotel in Hanoi. Start your tour today by a visit to Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum in the centre of Ba Dinh Square, where the embalmed body of Vietminh leader Ho Chi Minh is stored, followed by the Presidential Palace and Ho Chi Minh’s stilt house at the Palace’s back garden. Then, you will visit One Pillar Pagoda – symbol of Hanoi and the Temple of Literature – the first university in Vietnam. Keep touring around the West Lake that is bordered with many significant places such as Tran Quoc Pagoda and Quan Thanh Temple before lunch. Then a comfortable rickshaw ride tour around the ancient Old Quarter is included, and you will pass by the Hoan Kiem Lake along the way. At the end of the day, enjoy a Water Puppet Show, the proudest and most intricate traditional folk art of the country.

timeline.title: Day 3 Hanoi – Halong Bay
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner – Accommodation: On Cruise After breakfast you will head out for a 3-4 hour ride to the pier and begin your amaoldPrice Halong Bay cruise around noon. Sail around the UNESCO world heritage site and marvel at the grotesque limestone Karsts featuring in the islands of Halong Bay, such as Dinh Huong and Ga Choi etc. You have chance to have swimming in the beautiful bay, or kayaking in the picturesque area. Back to the boat and relax while sailing to peaceful area for overnight.

timeline.title: Day 4: Halong Bay – Hanoi – Danang – Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh CityMeal: Breakfast, Lunch ( or Bruncch)– Accommodation: Hotel in Hoi An Today, you will continue sailing around Halong Bay. In the morning, a Tai Chi lesson is arranged on the deck, or you could just sock in the beautiful view of limestone islands, charming beaches and amaoldPrice grottos. The cruise will pass by the Bai Tu Long Bay later. Enjoy your nice brunch when admiring the attractive scenery. Afterwards, your tour guide would wait for you at the dock and transfer you to the airport for your flight to Danang. On arrival, our car and guide will pick up at the airport and transfer to hotel in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 5: Hoi An
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Hotel in Hoi An Today’s exploration starts with the mysterious My Son Sanctuary, a group of ruined Hindu temples dating back to the Champa Kingdom, also known as “Angkor Wat in Vietnam”. Later in the afternoon, you will have a tour around the ancient town and visit some well-preserved historical sites, like Japanese Bridge, Chinese Temple and the former Vietnamese merchants’ houses.

timeline.title: Day 6: Hoi An Free
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast– Accommodation: Hotel in Hoi An Today you are free for relax on the beach, strolling in the town or whatever make you fancy.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoi An-Hue
timeline.description: In and around HueMeal: Breakfast– Accommodation: Hotel in Hue This morning, you will be transferred to Hue, another prominent historical city in Vietnam, via the Han Van Pass. Along the way, the Marble Mountain, famous for delicate stone sculptures and crafts, will be visited. You will arrive in Hue in the afternoon. After checking in, the rest of the day is on your own.

timeline.title: Day 8: Hue-Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Hotel in Ho Chi Minh City Today you will visit Minh Mang Tomb about 12km from Hue city center, with unique architecture. Then, a Royal Dragon Boat will take you to the seven-storey Thien Mu Pagoda while sailing along the Perfume River. Hue was capital of Vietnam in 19th Century with long history, so move on your journey to one of Vietnam’s seven UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Imperial Citadel and the Forbidden City, to find a hidden charm of Vietnam. In the convenient time, you can do some shopping in the biggest local market in Hue before the guide transfers you to the airport for your flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Upon arrival, you will be picked up and taken to the pre-booked hotel.

timeline.title: Day 9: Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: Meal: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Hotel in Ho Chi Minh City Today’s highlight will definitely be a tour around the famed Ho Chi Minh City landmarks. First, you will stop at the Notre Dame Cathedral, widely known as Red Church, then followed by a visit to the Old Post Office. Afterwards, you can appreciate some Vietnam War exhibits in the War Remnants Museum, and drop by the Independence Palace symbolioldPrice the reunification of Vietnam. After Lunch, continue your journey to the China Town and the Ben Thanh Market, where a wide variety of Vietnamese food and souvenirs can be found.

timeline.title: Day 10: Ho Chi Minh city- Cai Be Floating Market (Mekong Delta)
timeline.description: In and around Cai BeMeal: Breakfast, Lunch – Accommodation: Hotel in Ho Chi Minh City Today you will embark on a tour around the mighty Mekong River Delta. In the early morning, the guide will take you to a charming riverside town, Cai Be. Along the way, stop at a candy factory to observe the candy-making process, and enjoy traditional music in an orchard garden. After a nice lunch at a riverside restaurant, you will take a motor boat to visit some fluvial islands and also have an opportunity to explore the peaceful countryside by bicycle. Later in the day, the driver will wait at Vinh Long Pier and transfer you to Saigon. Relax and Overnight in the hotel.

timeline.title: Day 11: Saigon – Flight to Phu Quoc Island
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast – Accommodation: Phu Quoc hotel (4 star) You are free in the morning until the time check out and transfer to the airport for your flight to Phu Quoc. Free in Phu Quoc.

timeline.title: Day 12: Phu Quoc Free
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast – Accommodation: Phu Quoc hotel (4 star) You are free for these day to discover the beautiful island, relax, snorkeling, diving or whatever make you fancy.

timeline.title: Day 13: Phu Quoc Free
timeline.description: Meals: Breakfast – Accommodation: Phu Quoc hotel (4 star) You are free for these day to discover the beautiful island, relax, snorkeling, diving or whatever make you fancy.

timeline.title: Day 14: Depart from Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: Meals: NA – Accommodation: N/A Flight back to Ho Chi Minh City for your departure flight.

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi
timeline.description: In and around HanoiXin chao! Welcome to Vietnam. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm. If you arrive early into the capital of Hanoi, there’s plenty to see and do. Consider booking the Hanoi Highlights Urban Adventure with an expert local guide to introduce you to the city. Start by visiting the Temple of Literature, drop into a traditional tea house, and learn the stories of the Hoa Lo Prison museum. This tour concludes at Hoan Kiem Lake, surrounded by modern office buildings and ancient Buddhist temples. Or take it at your own pace and wander the Old Quarter and admire the city’s French-colonial architecture, relax in a park, or enjoy some street food. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 2: Sapa Homestay
timeline.description: In the morning, travel by private minibus from Hanoi towards Lao Chai in the Sapa region. The drive will take approximately 5 hours, which makes for the perfect opportunity to get to know your fellow travellers. Press on along the winding road before taking your first glimpse of Lao Chai village, sitting comfortably in a valley with cleared hillsides and rustic farmland. Stretch your legs as you walk off the bus, then begin a trek to your homestay in Ta Van (approximately 10 km/6 mi), enjoying a picnic lunch stop on the way. Your homestay is comfy, quaint and surrounded by pristine farmland. Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 3: Sapa
timeline.description: After breakfast at your homestay, trek to Giang Ta Chai – home to the Red Dzao hill people. Push on through terraced farmland and bamboo scrub for excellent views of emerald valleys and rushing waterfalls as you stroll on by (approximately 5km/3mi. Rest your legs on the bus ride back to Sapa. If you still have some energy once you arrive in Sapa perhaps visit the local market. This is a great place to pick up locally dyed fabrics, hemp plants and handmade textiles. In the evening, settle into your hotel in Sapa for the night. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 4: Ha Giang
timeline.description: In the morning, embark on a long bus journey (approximately 7 hours) to the province of Ha Giang. This is a highland region of forests and terraced rice paddies, with the mountains of Heaven’s Gate (Quan Ba pass) soaring in the background. The Ha Giang province also shares a border with southern China, and is known as Vietnam's final frontier. After relaxing and getting to know your surrounds, visit the local markets and shopfronts, which are relics of a bygone era. Afterwards venture to the the local museum and explore Cuom Village, witnessing the colourful traditional dress of the local people. The evening is free to spend as you wish. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 5: Dong Van
timeline.description: Today, leave for the first of many scenic mountain drives throughout Ha Giang province. Stop to browse Minh Tao Market before wandering through the village of Nam Luong. A visit to Mrs Mai’s Responsible Tourism project will be a highlight of the day. Learn about the stories of human trafficking and how the victims/witnesses of this crime found the opportunity of a life free from exploitation here. Afterwards pass through Lung Tam textile village and the Vuong Family Palace in Sa Phin commune, before continuing to Dong Van where you'll spend the night. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 6: Dong Van
timeline.description: After breakfast visit the local market, before setting off on a trekking loop that starts and finishes in Dong Van. The trek (approximately 4 hours in total) is moderate and suitable for those with an average fitness level. Wind your way through the spectacular landscape, where you can expect to witness glorious views and capture some amaoldPrice pictures of lush valleys and rice paddies. The evening is then free to relax or explore more of Dong Van. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 7: Bao Lac
timeline.description: Drive past terraced rice farms on the road to Bao Lac (approximately 4 hours), a small town in the mountainous region of northern Vietnam. The area is home to the Black Lo Lo ethnic group, who are well known for their colourful attire and finesse in making bronze drums. The bronze drums hold a special place in Lo Lo customs, being used at funerals and important family events. In Lo Lo culture, only the sound of the drums can help the souls of the dead find their way to the birthplace of their ancestors. Stay overnight in Bao Lac and perhaps explore the local marketplace and learn more about this fascinating culture.  Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 8: Ba Be Lake
timeline.description: Travel on to Ba Be Lake early in the morning (approximately 4 hours). Once there, head down the river by boat on an exploration of Ba Be National Park, visiting the largest natural lake in Vietnam. Disembark for some light walks along the way, visiting the impressive waterfalls that feed the lake and observing the natural flora and fauna. Return to land in the afternoon and head to a family-owned guesthouse where you will be spending the night. The family you’re staying with will prepare lunch and the rest of the day is then free to explore. In the evening sit down for a delicious dinner with your hosts. This is a great opportunity to gain an insight into their lives and culture. Accommodation: Guesthouse

timeline.title: Day 9: Hanoi
timeline.description: Head back to Hanoi after breakfast (approximately five hours). Use your free time exploring the boulevards and colonial buildings of the city. If you have time, visit the Hanoi Military Museum or take a look inside the city's spectacular Opera House. For your final evening in Hanoi, perhaps share a final dinner with the group at the KOTO restaurant, a project aimed at providing vocational training to disadvantaged young people. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 10: Hanoi
timeline.description: There are no activities included and you’re free to depart your accommodation at any time. If you would like to spend some more time in Hanoi, we’re happy to organise additional accommodation (subject to availability).

name: Vietnam Highlight Tour 11 Days/10 Nights
summary:
Ho Chi Minh City: City tour including entry to the War Remnants Museum & Cu Chi Tunnels.
Mekong Delta: Take an excursion to Mekong Delta, with a boat trip on the Mekong River to visit Cat Be floating market.Danang - Hoi An: See ancient sculpture in the Cham Museum, and tour Buddhist cave temples in the Marble Mountains. A walking tour through the UNESCO listed Old Quarter; Countryside bike ride, visit an old merchant house, the Hoi An Museum, and a Chinese assembly hall.
Hanoi: Sightseeing with a Local Guide; water puppets performance; visit Ho Chi Minh’s mausoleum, One Pillar Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Museum, Presidential Palace, and Temple of Literature; take a “cyclo” ride through the Old Quarter.
Halong Bay: Overnight cruise in a traditional Junk boat, discover caves & fishing villages, explore the lagoon.Mai Chau Valley: Escape from City to Bakhan Village Resort - the best brand new Mountain resort in the Northwest of Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrival Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
timeline.description:
In and around Da Nang, Ho Chi Minh CityToday you’ll land in Ho Chi Minh City (Tan Son Nhat International Airport). Warmly welcome by Tour Guide & Car Driver at airport then transfer to hotel for check in. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel 3* or similarStart point
 Airport pick up, Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Quận Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 736400, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 2: Full day Sightseeing in Ho Chi Minh City & Cu Chi Tunnels. (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi TunnelsThis morning enjoy a city tour that includes the Reunification Hall, formerly known as the Presidential Palace. It was towards this modern building that Communist tanks rolled on the morning of April 30, 1975, as Saigon fell. This fascinating building is filled with history still fresh in the minds of many. The tour also includes the Old Post Office, the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Jade Emperor Pagoda, Chinatown and Binh Tay Market – the central market for the city and one of the liveliest areas. Next we visit the Cu Chi Tunnels, the incredible network of tunnels that once stretched for 210 miles. This underground complex was built by guerilla fighters beginning in 1940 and construction continued throughout the Vietnam War. We return to our hotel where the evening is free. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 3: Full day to Mekong Delta/River Boat Trip - Fly to Hoi An. (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnToday takes you to My Tho, the capital of Tien Giang Province. Situated on the Mekong River, 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, the city is surrounded by orchards and rice fields, which produce grain for the entire country. Visit one or two of the islands that produce traditional handcrafts, coconut candy and bee farms. Visit the Vinh Trang Pagoda, the oldest one in the delta on your boat trip on the Mekong River. Return to Ho Chi Minh City. Transfer to Airport for flight to Hoi An Ancient Town. Arrive Da Nang Airport and pick up at evening time. Transfer to hotel for check in. Overnight in Hoi An Ancient Town. Phu Thinh Resort Hoi An 4* or similar

timeline.title: Day 4: Cycling Tra Que Village - Cooking Class (B, L)
timeline.description: 8:00am: Have breakfast at hotel. Our guide welcomes you at hotel in Hoi An and ride bicycle to Tra Que Vegetable Village far from Hoi An Ancient Town 3km. You ride through peaceful villages and enjoy the beauty of countryside surrounding Hoi An. Arrive in Tra Que Vegetable Village; you can experience the living and working of local farmers at this organic vegetable and herb garden. Your learn how to prepare soil, grow vegetable, water to get fresh vegetables as you see at the garden from previous tourists. You have 15 minutes foot massaged by herb to fresh yourself. Here is the chance for you to join in cooking class with the family. Under the instruction how to prepare ingredients, you will cook Hoi An special foods like Tam Huu Spring Roll, BanhXeo pancake… Have lunch at the family. And then ride bicycle back Hoi An Town or hotel. Trip ends at 3:00pm. Pm: This afternoon you have more free time to experience around the town to get some souvenir gifts or spend your time at Cua Dai beach - 4km from the ancient town. Free to have your own dinner.  Phu Thinh Resort 4* or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Full day Explore Hoi An - Night Train to Hanoi. (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiA full-day tour here includes the Japanese Covered Bridge, the beautiful Chinese Assembly Halls, the Phuok Kien Pagoda, and the local market. You’ll also take a boat trip on the Thu Bon River to a village of woodworkers and boat building families on Cam Kim Island. Later visit a local school for a very special visit with what are sure to become your newest friends ("Make a Friend" program). Free for leisure and go shopping until 5:00pm. 5:30pm. Leave Hoi An Ancient Town for Da Nang City to take overnight Train to Hanoi around 7:00pm. Tonight you stay overnight on the Train. (4 Berths Cabin Soft Sleeper, sharing).

timeline.title: Day 6: Arrive Hanoi City by night Train
timeline.description: You`ll arrive Hanoi Train Station around 12:00pm. Pick up & transfer to Hanoi Downtown to check in hotel. You`re free to discover Hoan Kiem Lake, Ngoc Son Temple, Dong Xuan Market, Old Quarter, market square. Overnight in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi to Halong Bay Cruise & stay overnight on Board. (B, L, D)
timeline.description: Early this morning, we’ll drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Ha Long Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. We’ll spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since we’re overnight on the water, we’ll be able to explore Ha Long Bay’s most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Board. Garden Bay Cruises 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 8: Halong Bay to Hanoi. (B, L)
timeline.description: Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, we have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay. After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave, swim and relax. Cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served while you are cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cruise check-out. Rejoin car drive back to Hanoi for overnight. Arrive Hanoi at 3:00pm. Check in hotel & free time to go sightseeing in the Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 9: Hanoi - Mai Chau Valley - Ba Khan Village Resort (B, L, D)
timeline.description: 08h30. Depart from Hanoi. Enjoy a scenic drive along one of the most beautiful country road to the peaceful Bakhan Village via Hoa Binh City. 10:30: Take a short break for tea/coffee in the middle way. 12h00. Lunch at Bakhan Village Restaurant. Check-in room. 15h00. Afternoon walk around the Muong Village of Khan Ha and village’s West hill for a breath taking view of the valley. 19h00. Dinner time at Bakhan Restaurant. 20h00 -21h00. Enjoy the unique traditional dance by Villagers Overnight at Bakhan Village Resort Bakhan Village Resort 4*

timeline.title: Day 10: Bakhan Village - Hanoi (B, L)
timeline.description: 09h00. Take another great workout in nature with our East Mountain trek route.  11h00. Back to the resort. Rest and relax  12h00. Check out. Enjoy lunch at the resort 13h30. Depart for Hanoi. 17h00. Arrive Hanoi Old Quarter. Check in hotel and overnight in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 11: Hanoi Conclude/ Departure. (B)
timeline.description:
You have the morning free to relax before your return flight home. You`ll be transferred to Airport for your next flight! Finish your unforgettable trip with Legend Travel Group at Airport! Good bye and see you again!End point
 Airport transfer, Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam

name: Vietnam Discovery
highlights: Shop for lanters in Hoi An
Visit ancient pagodas and cathedrals
Explore the Forbidden Purple City
Cruise around Halong Bay

timeline.title: Day 1: Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: In and around Ho Chi Minh CityXin chao! Welcome to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm today. As you won’t be spending much time in Ho Chi Minh City, we recommend arriving a few days early to see more of this fascinating city. See the ancient pagodas and cathedrals near the former Presidential Palace, historic Dong Khoi Street, and the chaotic markets of Ben Thanh and Cholon (Chinatown). Better yet, consider taking a day trip such as Urban Adventure’s Cu Chi Experience. See urbanadventures.com/destination/ho-chi-minh-city-tours for more information on the range of Ho Chi Minh City day tours. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 2: Mekong Delta
timeline.description: This morning, head away from the city and make your way to the province of Ben Tre, where you’ll get on a boat to tour the canals of the Mekong Delta. This fertile area is famous for its abundance of fruit, flower and rice crops, and is known as the ‘rice bowl’ of Vietnam. During your boat ride you’ll visit some cottage industries along the river before heading to your guesthouse. Staying in simple local accommodation close to the delta, hosted by a Vietnamese family, will be one of the highlights of your trip, giving you a taste of community life as well as the chance to enjoy a traditional home-cooked meal. Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 3: Mekong Delta – Ho Chi Minh City – Overnight Train
timeline.description: Rise early to the sounds of the river coming alive, and enjoy a simple breakfast before boarding the boat back down the delta and catching a bus back to Ho Chi Minh City. Enjoy some free time in Ho Chi Minh City this afternoon, perhaps with a visit to the War Remnants Museum or Reunification Palace. If you haven’t already, head to Ben Thanh Market for some delicious street food, colourful shopping and even more colourful characters. This evening, board an overnight train bound for Danang. Trains are a common form of transport for the Vietnamese, so sit back and relax into this local experience. Accommodation: Overnight sleeper train

timeline.title: Day 4: Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnArrive in Danang by train and travel by minibus for approximately 1 hour to Hoi An. Hoi An was recently declared a World Heritage town and is being beautifully restored. It was a major trading port with the West from the 17th century. Today, parts of Hoi An look exactly as they did more than a century ago. Your leader will take you on a sightseeing walk through the Old Town and visit some of the city's major attractions. A sightseeing pass is included in your tour so you can visit a selection of the major sights. Hoi An is also a shopping mecca, so head down to the markets and street stalls to browse paintings, woodwork, ceramics and lanterns. It’s also famous for its tailors who can make beautiful items to order, and with almost three full days here you have the chance to have some unique pieces whipped up. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 5: Hoi An
timeline.description: Wake up for a free morning to do as you please. It’s a great opportunity to take a trip out to the My Son temples – a World Heritage-listed site constructed between the 4th and 14th centuries that reflects the rich cultural traditions of the Cham civilisation. In the afternoon, swap walking for cycling with a bike ride through the countryside near Hoi An. There's no better way to explore the peaceful area than on two wheels. You’ll see places few tourists get the chance to see among the green rice paddies and small creeks, which will give you a true insight into rural life in Vietnam. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 6: Hoi An
timeline.description: You’ve got another day to explore this historic haven. Perhaps book in your final tailoring fitting this morning to make sure the threads you’re getting made fit like a glove, or hire a bike for a lazy ride out to the South China Sea to relax on An Bang or Cua Dai beach. Hoi An is also known for its great food, so you could book yourself in for a cooking class to take some culinary secrets away with you. Most tours include a trip to the local food markets, and some take you on a short boat journey along the Thu Bon River. Let your local leader know what you're into and they will be able to recommend some activities to suit. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 7: Hue
timeline.description: In and around HueBid farewell to Hoi An this morning and make your way to Hue. The drive in a private vehicle will take around 5 hours. You’ll be travelling on the incredible Hai Van Pass, through lush mountains and past scenic lookouts, and there’ll be some good places for a photo stop. Once in Hue, you’ll have a free afternoon to explore. Hue was once Vietnam’s imperial capital and has a curious mix of bustling streets and tranquil enclaves. Perhaps visit the Dong Ba Market, which sells everything imaginable and is a great place to spend some time. It’s important to know that Hue is renowned for its cuisine, with some delicious dishes originating from this region, including bun bo hue (Hue’s delicious take on pho), and banh khoai (a filled turmeric crepe). Time to give your tastebuds a workout. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 8: Hue – Overnight Train
timeline.description: Enjoy a free day in Hue. Perhaps visit the Imperial Citadel which includes the Forbidden Purple City that was almost totally destroyed during the Vietnam War. The gaping holes left by bombs give you an idea of how much destruction occurred in this country. Another optional activity is a dragon boat cruise along the Perfume River and then a visit to Thien Mu Pagoda – the unofficial symbol of Hue. Here you’ll see an active Buddhist monastery dating back to 1601 and a car belonging to the monk who tragically set himself alight in public to protest against the treatment of Buddhists. You may also like to visit one of the royal tombs, that of Emperor Tu Duc, with its central lake set amid a grove of frangipani and pine trees. This evening, take another overnight train bound for Hanoi. The journey will take approximately 12 hours. Accommodation: Overnight sleeper train

timeline.title: Day 9: Hanoi
timeline.description: In and around HanoiArrive in Hanoi at about 5 am and transfer to your hotel. Once you’ve dropped off your bags and freshened up, embark on a walking tour of Vietnam’s charming capital. Explore the 36 streets of Hanoi’s Old Quarter – locally known as this because of each street originally selling a specific type of product. Continue on to the Dong Xuan Market and Hoan Kiem Lake, making sure you check out the unique architecture along the way. Hanoi has a French provincial feel left over from colonial times, but it also has a Buddhist influence and striking modern buildings. The rest of the day is yours to explore Hanoi as you please. In the evening, why not get your group together and head out to a bustling night market for some local fare. Sitting on plastic stools and eating on the roadside is a rite of passage in Vietnam. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 10: Da Bac
timeline.description: Leave Hanoi after breakfast around 8 am and make the drive to Sung Village (approximately 4 hours). There are around 70 families living at Sung Village and the majority are Dzao ‘Tien’ people. Farming and forest plantations are their main source of income. Enjoy lunch at your homestay then take an introductory walk around the village. After getting to know the village better, take a short trek (approximately two kilometres) to the alluring Sung Cave and visit a 100-year-old tea plantation. The trek has some steep and slippery sections so make sure you’ve packed suitable footwear for this activity. After a local handicraft workshop, return to your homestay accommodation for a nice hot shower and a delicious dinner. Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 11: Hanoi
timeline.description: This morning, take the opportunity to encounter more of the Vietnamese highlands on a ten-kilometre (6.2 mi) trek from Sung Village to Da Bia. The first eight kilometres of the trek is on mostly flat ground along well-worn buffalo tracks. The final two kilometres gradually incline and for a period of approximately 300 metres there are some steps to climb, but the walk will be at a steady and relaxed pace. Keep an eye out for the monumental stone at the peak of Da Bia Mountain during the hike while you walk through local villages, meeting people from the ethnic Muong tribe. Stop for lunch at Da Bia before enjoying a scenic 1.5-hour boat cruise on Hoa Binh hydropower reservoir. Arrive at Thung Nai then board a bus transfer to Hanoi (approximately 2 hours), arriving at around 6 pm. This evening is free for you to explore this delightful city. Why not relax with a bia hoi (freshly brewed draught beer) at one of the microbars in the Old Quarter? Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 12: Cat Ba Island
timeline.description: Get up early for the 7.30 am bus, stop for a quick break, then jump on the ferry. This morning of travel will deliver you to beautiful Cat Ba Island before midday. There's no time to waste, so begin exploring the stunning waters of Lan Ha Bay around Cat Ba. Located in the greater Halong Bay area, Lan Ha Bay is one of Vietnam’s most scenic places, where limestone islands and caves rise from the emerald waters. You’ll have a free afternoon to explore at your own pace, so perhaps get active on a hike, or just enjoy a dip at one of the beaches. Have a relaxing evening on Cat Ba Island. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 13: Cat Ba Island
timeline.description: This morning, head out on the water from Cat Ba and continue exploring the limestone karst scenery. Take a boat around Lan Ha Bay with an included lunch while you cruise, then get up close and personal with this striking landscape by kayak. There’s the option to have a net on the side of your kayak and help out the locals’ clean-up efforts. This initiative hopes to eliminate the rising amounts of plastic waste in the bay. Lan Ha and Halong Bay are on many travellers' bucket lists, and with two days in the area you’ll get to tick them off yours. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 14: Hanoi
timeline.description: Rise and shine! Perhaps start your morning with a refreshing swim or a Vietnamese coffee (or both). Make sure you soak up as much sun and sand as possible, because this afternoon it's back to Hanoi by ferry and bus. Tonight you may want to head out for an optional dinner with your fellow travellers, sharing some memories and laughs over a local meal and beer. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 15: Hanoi
timeline.description: There are no activities planned for today and you’re able to depart the accommodation at any time after check-out. With so much to see and do in Hanoi, we recommend that you spend an extra day or two here, and we’ll be happy to organise additional accommodation (subject to availability). Urban Adventures has some great experiences in and around Hanoi, including Citadels, Karsts & Cycle, which is a great activity visiting the ancient citadel of Hoa Lu and taking a rowboat through the magnificent caves of Trang An. Head to urbanadventures.com/destination/hanoi-tours for more information.

name: Vietnam Highlight Tour Package 7Days/6Nights

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi City Tour Depart to Ho Chi Minh City (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around Ho Chi Minh CityYou have a full day of sightseeing ahead, including a visit to One Pillar Pagoda, which was built by Ly Thai Tong and the Temple of Literature, founded by Emperor Ly Thanh Tong. Stop in the heart of Hanoi at Hoan Kiem Lake, which contains an islet with a tiny Tortoise Pagoda. After lunch at a local restaurant, visit Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, the Opera House and St. Joseph Cathedral. Conclude with a visit to Bao Tang Lich, once the museum of lEcole Francaise dExtreme Orient, which includes artifacts from Vietnams turbulent history. Water Puppet Show, Cyclo visiting Old Quarter. Transfer to Airport for Ho Chi Minh City departure. Arrive Ho Chi Minh City in the evening. Pick up from airport then transfer to hotel for check in. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Ho Chi Minh City Tour - Cu Chi Tunnels (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi TunnelsToday you will visit the largest Vietnamese city. There are street markets, sidewalk cafes and sleek new bars. This teeming metropolis offers 300 years of timeless traditions and the beauty of an ancient culture. To the west of the city is the huge Chinese neighborhood called Cho lon, which means Big Market. Notre Dame Cathedral, in the heart of Saigons government quarter, is of neo- Romanesque architecture with two high square tower and iron spires. The Central Post Office is French-style and City Hall, known as Hotel de Ville, is typical of the French architecture that would be seen in any village in France. Visit the War Remnants Museum, featuring collections of weapons and photographs from the two Indochina wars. Leave Saigon for Cu Chi Tunnels to learn about Vietnam history & Vietnam War. Return to hotel for free. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City. Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 6: Mekong Delta Cruise full day. (B, L)
timeline.description: Today takes you to My Tho, the capital of Tien Giang Province. Situated on the Mekong River, 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, the city is surrounded by orchards and rice fields, which produce grain for the entire country. Visit one or two of the islands that produce traditional handcrafts, coconut candy and bee farms. Visit the Vinh Trang Pagoda, the oldest one in the delta on your boat trip on the Mekong River. Return to Ho Chi Minh City. Check in hotel & stay overnight in Saigon. Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 7: Conclude Ho Chi Minh City/Departure (B)
timeline.description:
Having breakfast at hotel in Ho Chi Minh City until your international flight departure. We will drive your family until Airport for departure! You will finish the unforgettable Vietnam Trip with Legend Travel at airport! Good bye & see you in the next time!End point
 Airport Transfer, Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Quận Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 736400, Vietnam
